weka.classifiers.rules

Class Vfdr

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.classifiers.AbstractClassifier
      • weka.classifiers.rules.Vfdr
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, weka.classifiers.Classifier, weka.classifiers.UpdateableClassifier, weka.core.BatchPredictor, weka.core.CapabilitiesHandler, weka.core.CapabilitiesIgnorer, weka.core.CommandlineRunnable, weka.core.OptionHandler, weka.core.RevisionHandler, weka.core.TechnicalInformationHandler

extends weka.classifiers.AbstractClassifier

      • setHoeffdingConfidence

        @OptionMetadata(displayName="hoeffdingConfidence",
                commandLineParamName="C",
                description="The allowable error in the decision to expand a rule. Values closer to zero will take longer to decide.",
                commandLineParamSynopsis="-C <confidence value>",
                displayOrder=6)
public void setHoeffdingConfidence(double c)
        Sets the allowable error in an expansion decision. Its value is one minus the desired probability of choosing the correct attribute. Used in the computation of the Hoeffding bound. Default is 1E-7.
        Parameters:
        c - New confidence value

      • setHoeffdingTieThreshold

        @OptionMetadata(displayName="hoeffdingTieThreshold",
                commandLineParamName="T",
                description="Theshold below which a rule expansion will be forced in order to break ties.",
                commandLineParamSynopsis="-T <threshold value>",
                displayOrder=5)
public void setHoeffdingTieThreshold(double t)
        Sets the threshold below which an expansion will be forced in order to break ties. Default is 0.05.
        Parameters:
        t - New tie threshold

      • setPredictionStrategy

        @OptionMetadata(displayName="predictionStrategy",
                commandLineParamName="S",
                description="The prediction strategy to use (0 = majority class, 1 = naive Bayes)",
                commandLineParamSynopsis="-S <strategy code>",
                displayOrder=4)
public void setPredictionStrategy(int n)
        Sets whether subsequently created instances will use naive bayes or not to make predictions. A parameter of 0 will set the strategy to majority class.
        Parameters:
        n - The code of the strategy (0 = majority class, 1 = naive Bayes)

      • setGracePeriod

        @OptionMetadata(displayName="gracePeriod",
                commandLineParamName="G",
                description="Number of instances a rule should observe between expansion attempts. You should adapt this to the size of your training set",
                commandLineParamSynopsis="-G <period value>",
                displayOrder=1)
public void setGracePeriod(int n)
        Sets the number of instances a rule should observe between expansion attempts.
        Parameters:
        n - The new grace period

      • setOrderedSet

        @OptionMetadata(displayName="orderedSet",
                commandLineParamName="O",
                description="Is the rule set ordered?",
                commandLineParamSynopsis="-O",
                commandLineParamIsFlag=true,
                displayOrder=4)
public void setOrderedSet(boolean b)
        Returns true if the rule set is ordered. An ordered rule set uses a First Hit classification strategy and examples update only the first rule that covers them.
        Parameters:
        b - true if the rule set is ordered

      • setNBWeightThreshold

        @OptionMetadata(displayName="nbWeightThreshold",
                commandLineParamName="N",
                description="The minimum weight a rule requires to make predictions using naive Bayes",
                commandLineParamSynopsis="-N <threshold value>",
                displayOrder=4)
public void setNBWeightThreshold(double n)
        Sets the minimal weight a rule requires to make predictions using naive Bayes.
        Parameters:
        n - The minimal weight
